intro: Phyllarthron bojeranum var. elongatum, commonly known as the elongated phyllarthron, is a rare tropical plant characterized by its elongated, lance-shaped leaves. It belongs to the family Phyllarthronaceae and is native to specific regions in Southeast Asia. The plant exhibits a climbing habit, often using its tendrils to ascend supporting structures. Its flowers are small and clustered, typically displaying a combination of white and green hues. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
